Description: The biological understanding of the myeloproliferative neoplasms (essential thrombocythemia, polycythemia vera and myelofibrosis) continues validate a model of progression acquired somatic mutations and secondary inflammation and microenvironment issues leading to risk of vascular events, marrow dysfunction, organomegaly, symptomatic burden, progressive disease and possible early mortality. In this session, Dr. Ruben Mesa will discuss current and evolving therapies for ET (new 2L trials with LSD1 inhibition and interferons), PV (newly approved interferons and hepcidin agonists), and MF (new JAK inhibitors, combination front line therapies, new agents in second line alone or in combination) that aim to address the various disease manifestations/disease burden of MPNs.
